intro: Bicornella filiformis, commonly known as the slender bicornellia, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring. Its growth habit is usually herbaceous, with stems that can be either erect or prostrate depending on the environmental conditions. Bicornella filiformis is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories or along stream banks.
